intro: Mesembryanthemum umbelliflorum, commonly known as the starflower or honeycomb flower, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, thick leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for arid and semi-arid climates. Its unique floral structure resembles a honeycomb, giving it its common name. Mesembryanthemum umbelliflorum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
